title: 2 Simple Ways to Clear the Cache on Safari Browser

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. You can find it on your Home screen or in the App Library. [1] X Research source Use this method to clear the cache and cookies on Safari . You can also clear the cache from Google Chrome if needed.

steps.title: Tap Safari.
steps.content: Tap Safari . You can find this in the list of pre-installed iOS apps.

steps.title: Tap Clear History and Website Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear History and Website Data . You may need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Tap All History.
steps.content: Tap All History . This is the bottom option in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap Clear History.
steps.content: Tap Clear History . Your cookies, cache, and history will be deleted.

steps.title: Clear your cache without deleting history (optional).
steps.content: Clear your cache without deleting history (optional). If you want to just clear your cache and keep your browsing history , do the following: Go to Settings . Tap Safari . Tap Advanced . Tap Website Data . Tap Remove All Website Data .

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. This looks like a compass.

steps.title: Click Safari.
steps.content: Click Safari . You can find this in the top toolbar.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy.
steps.content: Click Privacy . This is the tab at the top.

steps.title: Click Manage Website Data.
steps.content: Click Manage Website Data . This is next to the Cookies and website data header. A window will open with "all stored website data," Kats assures.

steps.title: Select the site(s) to clear your cache for.
steps.content: Select the site(s) to clear your cache for. The site will be highlighted.

steps.title: Click Remove or Remove All.
steps.content: Click Remove or Remove All . The cache will be cleared.
